definition: strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort

sentences.english: What does this sketchy historical record suggest for today's number one power?
sentences.chinese: 上述粗略的歷史回顧，對今天的頭號強國有何啓示呢？

sentences.english: America and Germany do well in inland river navigation.
sentences.chinese: 美國和德國是內河航運強國。

sentences.english: So, as we say, high technology is the root to enstrength our country.
sentences.chinese: 因此，我們說高新科技纔是強國之本。

sentences.english: With its financial resources and engineering savvy, Japan remains a world power.
sentences.chinese: 以其財富和工業實力而論，日本仍然是世界強國。

sentences.english: Soccer’s best nations convene in South Africa for the month-long FIFA World Cup.
sentences.chinese: 足球強國聚集南非參加爲期一個月的國際足聯世界盃。

sentences.english: The prosperous common people powerful nation, the stable development, is immediately the people numerous hearts looks.
sentences.chinese: 當下富民強國，穩定發展，是國人衆心所望。

sentences.english: For unlike the great powers of old, we have not sought world domination.
sentences.chinese: 與歷代強國不同，我們沒有追求世界霸權。

sentences.english: And international law constrains strong nations more than it does the weak.
sentences.chinese: 因而，國際法對強國的限制要大於弱國。

sentences.english: Powerful states would be more likely to withstand an army of flesh-eating ghouls.
sentences.chinese: 強國更可能起而抵抗嗜肉的食屍鬼軍隊。

sentences.english: International institutions would be deployed selectively, when they served the main powers' interests.
sentences.chinese: 國際組織將會有選擇地部署，以實現主要強國的利益。

sentences.english: After his death in battle, Sweden became known as a military powerhouse.
sentences.chinese: 在他戰死之後，瑞典逐漸成爲了軍事強國。

sentences.english: Reform and opening up are ways to make China powerful.
Reform and opening up are the path to a stronger China.
sentences.chinese: 堅持改革開放，是我們的強國之路。

sentences.english: But the largest country of steel production does not mean that It is the strong country of steel trade .
sentences.chinese: 但是，鋼鐵生產大國並不意味着是鋼鐵貿易的強國。

sentences.english: The small country allied itself to the stronger power.
Suddenly, the world's superpower and the newest great power are nose to nose.
sentences.chinese: 突然間，世界超級大國和新興強國兵刃相見。

definition: railtrack connection/to integrate into sth/to dock/to connect/to be in step with/to bring into line with/to align
lit. to proclaim oneself hegemon/to take a leading role/to build a personal fiefdom
